text: Hello! Anyone knows a way I can get amount of contacts that user has through API? Cannot find anything in documentation.

Go to Settings->Properties and select Deal Properties.  You will see there are calculation properties for Is Deal Open, Is Deal Closed and others.  If you click on one you can the click on the <> to see what the underlying internal name you would use in programming is.
I think for the most part that is true - some of us do try and help where we can
You will need to do it by filtering their associations to the contact owner
oh… interesting idea.  But What if I do not care who is the owner, but I just want to find out how much contacts there are on the account at all?
Just to clarify, you want to know, how many contacts a user within a HubSpot account owns?
Why do I get this error when I click on that url?
I get that url from the endpoint

Hello everyone - I am using the new v4 automation API & it is returning a 404 when calling a known workflow. When I change this call to leverage the v3, I access the workflow details with no issue. I confirmed my portal is enabled for the beta. Any thoughts on what could be happening there? If you can JITA in, my portal is here: <https://app.HubSpot.com/private-apps/496787/1840969/logs/api>?
Ah, does the v4 have different workflow IDs? Edit: yes.
Was it clicked directly after the link was generated ? My guess is that the link might expire
Just figured out because of you there was a V4 hahaha. You might have solved my issue. I will try tomorrow

What’s the use case/why?

The most straightforward way is to get every record using the basic “List” Get request (get a page of records, keep a running count of the records as you iterate to get more pages.  

An alternative approach would be to create a HubSpot List that adds every contact using criteria like “create date is known”, then get the list details after processing. There’s a count of object records in the list details <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/lists|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/lists>

I probably would also recommended the list way or you can use the search api, set a filter that equals the user. You can even set the limit to one to keep the size of the response small. With the search response you also get a total count of contacts.

Can you describe your use case in a bit more detail? (Who are you sending to? How is the email triggered? What data do you want to populate?)

Sounds like you may want to either explore using the Single Send API or potentially programmable email 
• <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/email/hubdb-crm-objects|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/email/hubdb-crm-objects>
• <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/marketing/single-send-api|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/marketing/single-send-api> (can be marketing or transactional type)

Hi everyone,

I was created custom action, when setup workflow and put Contact Date property token to my custom action input, my action endpoint received input value in short date format (m/d/yy).
How to get Date value in (dd/MM/YYYY) format?
Thanks!
